verbose_text: Borgdorff et al established an important role for the cyclin dependent kinase (CDK) inhibitor, p21 (Waf1 / Cip1), in the growth control of human mammary epithelial cells (HMECs) and analyzed the repertoire of miRNAs that modulate the activity of this tumor suppressor, demonstrating that miR-130b reduced p21 expression and in turn blocked Ras (G12V)-induced senescence.
evidence: p21 expression and in turn blocked Ras
